name: Parsing issue
message:
Hello there,

If you've updated your Quest, the game might not be compatible with the new API implemented by Meta—this requires the game developer to release an update. Alternatively, if your Quest OS is older and the game has been updated to the new API, you'll need to update your Quest.

name: ScrCpy2 Audio routing
message:
Hello there,

By default, ScrCpy2—the tool used for streaming—routes audio out of the box. While there's no in-app method to stop this, you can learn how to disable audio rerouting by visiting the ScrCpy2 GitHub page. Here's the [link](https://github.com/Genymobile/scrcpy/blob/master/doc/audio.md) for more information.

name: USB Problems
message:
Hello there,

You might be dealing with a faulty USB cable. Test with other cables you have on hand, or borrow one if possible, before considering a new purchase. Don't forget to experiment with different USB ports and rotating the Type-C end 180 degrees. 

Should you momentarily establish a USB connection, switch to 'Enable wireless mode' in the SideQuest app.

For future convenience, consider using the easy installer to directly install SideQuest on your headset once you find a working cable.

We hope this resolves your issue. Keep us updated on your progress!

Best of luck on your journey, traveller!

name: Unknown Sources v55
message:
Hey there!

On the home screen inside your headset, look for a button on the right with a 3x3 square grid. This is the 'App Library' button. Click it, then click on the search bar. A filter icon should show up next to the search box. Click this icon and at the bottom of the drop-down list that appears, pick 'Unknown Sources'.

This will let you see all the games you've installed from SideQuest. You can then pick a game and start playing!

I hope this helps! Safe travels on your journey.

name: Unknown Sources v54
message:
Hey there!

On the home screen in your headset, find the 'App Library' button on the right, which has a 3x3 square grid on it. After clicking this, a new window will open. At the top right of this window, you'll see a filter icon. Click it and choose 'Unknown Sources' at the end of the drop-down list that appears.

This will display all the games you've installed from SideQuest. Now, you can choose any game and start playing!

I hope this is helpful! Enjoy your journey, traveller!

name: Not SideQuest Support
message:
Hi traveller! 

Games and apps on SideQuest can sometimes be tough to crack. This could be because they're either under development or targeted towards advanced users. For game-specific questions, it's a good idea to reach out directly to the game developer. Links to their social media and Discord can be found on the game's page on the right side.

If you're grappling with a tricky technical procedure, don't hesitate to ask for help from friends or family. Just remember, this community is focused on supporting SideQuest-related issues, so our capacity to help beyond that is limited. We hope you find the help you need soon!

Godspeed traveller

name: Meta Support refer
message:
Hey there! 

Thank you for reaching out. At first glance, it appears that the issue may be related to the services provided by Meta, rather than something we can directly assist with. We'll loop back if we gather more information. Meanwhile, you might find it helpful to contact [Meta Quest Support](https://www.meta.com/help/support/). Safe travels!

name: APK install on Mobile
message:
Hey there!

We understand your desire to install APK files on the move. However, this feature was intentionally excluded to prevent SideQuest's misuse for piracy. In the past, this feature in our desktop app was significantly abused. To prevent similar misuse on mobile, we chose not to include this functionality in our mobile app. You can continue using our desktop app or consider the Bugjaeger app on Android. Best of luck on your journey, traveler!

name: Piracy
message:
Hello traveller! 

Thank you for contacting us. It seems you might be trying to use SideQuest for piracy, which we firmly oppose. We host numerous giveaways if you're interested in free games—keep an eye on our Twitter and Discord for these opportunities.

Best wishes for your adventure!

name: Not Authorized
message:
Hello there,

Try restarting your headset and switching dev mode off and on.

A defective USB cable could be the culprit. Experiment with other cables you possess or borrow one before purchasing a new one. Try different USB ports and flip the Type-C end 180 degrees.

Re-verifying their developer account (using a credit card instead of a phone number), toggling dev mode, and factory resetting have worked for some users.

If possible, use another PC or the SideQuest app from the Android play store for testing.

Remember, [Meta Quest Support](https://www.meta.com/help/support/) is there to help.

Godspeed!

name: Premature end of stream, needed 1 more bytes
message:
Hi traveller! 

Thanks for reaching out. This problem can arise from several factors. A frequent cause is a USB connection issue. Try using a different USB cable or port if you can, and steer clear of USB3 because of its known ADB compatibility issues, which is the fundamental connection to your headset. The problem might also be tied to a specific app on SideQuest. Let us know if it's only happening with one app. Wishing you luck on your journey, brave traveler!

name: INSTALL_FAILED_INSUFFICIENT_STORAGE
message:
Hey there! 

This error - INSTALL_FAILED_INSUFFICIENT_STORAGE - means your headset storage space is low. Try uninstalling some apps or games. God speed traveller!

name: INSTALL_FAILED_VERSION_DOWNGRADE
message:
Hey there! 

The error you're encountering—INSTALL_FAILED_VERSION_DOWNGRADE—indicates that the app you're attempting to install already exists on your device, and the installed version is newer. To resolve this, you'll need to uninstall the current app before attempting reinstallation.

Remember to uninstall the app from all accounts on your headset.

If you can't locate the app in 'Unknown Sources', it's suggested to uninstall it from the desktop SideQuest app. Navigate to the 'My Apps' screen on SideQuest, locate the app using its name or package name (e.g., net.kdt.pojavlaunch for QuestCraft), click on the cogwheel icon, and then select 'Uninstall'. 

God speed traveller!

name: QuestCraft Issues
message:
Hey there! 

While we might not have the ideal advice for you on this matter, we can certainly guide you to the right resource! For assistance and support, consider visiting [Quest Craft Discord](https://discord.gg/questcraft). Godspeed traveller!

name: Beat Saber Mods
message:
Hey there! 

While we might not have the ideal advice for you on this matter, we can certainly guide you to the right resource! For assistance and support, consider visiting [Beat Saber Mods Discord](https://discord.gg/beatsabermods). Godspeed traveller!

name: Chromebook Support
message:
Hey there! 

We wish we could support Chromebooks but it's simply not possible - unfortunately it's an issue on the Chromebook end. God speed traveller!

name: Linux Support
message:
Hey!

Support for Linux is somewhat limited due to the vast number of distributions and occasional need for additional software or configuration.

Typically, you can extract the tarball and run either `./sidequest` or `./sidequestlite`, depending on your version. The app, built on Electron, is open-source—Linux users can compile it from the source available at [SideQuest's GitHub repository](https://github.com/SideQuestVR/SideQuest).

I hope this information proves helpful!

name: Screen copy Mac
message:
Hey there!

SideQuest utilizes a software called scrcpy (Screen Copy) for streaming. While not included in the Mac version of SideQuest due to various reasons, it's still possible to use scrcpy on Mac. Check out [guiscrcpy](https://guiscrcpy.srev.in/), a free software that leverages scrcpy and supports Mac. 

Best of luck traveller!

name: Advanced Installer
message:
Hey there! 

Thanks for reaching out. If you go to the download page and you will find the Advanced Installer on the right, grab that instead.

https://sdq.st/download

Godspeed traveller!

name: Connecting...
message:
Hey there! 

Thanks for reaching out. This issue arises when something hinders ADB from running. Attempt uninstalling SideQuest, and when prompted to remove app data, select 'yes'. Then, install the latest version from [here](https://sdq.st/download)—scroll down for the Advanced Installer.

If you continue to face issues, your antivirus might be blocking ADB. Check its Vault, Quarantine, or similar sections for an entry named 'ADB.exe' and remove it. Temporarily disabling your antivirus can also help identify if it's causing the issue.

Should the problem persist, consider trying on a different computer or using our Android app on Google Play. 

Godspeed traveller!

name: Downloading...
message:
Hello there!

It seems that while you were downloading, the USB cable may have temporarily disconnected making the download get stuck.

I would recommend reconnecting the Quest to SideQuest via the USB again, then immediately switch to Wi-Fi mode.

An even easier option is to use the ‘Easy installer’ on the PC to install SideQuest to the headset, or on the mobile app, click the 3 dots in the bottom right corner and go to tools, at the top you’ll see ‘Install SideQuest into your headset’.

https://sidequestvr.com/setup-howto

All the best on your journey, traveller!

name: I'll try to replicate that
message:
Hello there,

I'm going to see if I can test that and reproduce it on my end. If I can't then we'll keep an eye out for more reports.

Be back soon traveller!

name: Couldn't replicate (I'll try to replicate that optional PART 2)
message:
Okay, so I've run some tests and couldn't replicate the issue you're having.

Try restarting your Quest or even factory resetting it.

We'll keep an eye on it but we've had no other reports of this happening so far.

Best of luck on your journey traveller!

name: BONELAB mod)
message:
Hello there, If you would like access to the full mod list for BONELAB from inside the headset, SideQuest now lets you have access to that with one click.

Inside either version of SideQuest on PC, go to the tools page and scroll down to a button saying ‘ENABLE BONELAB MODS’ and click it!

![](https://i.ibb.co/VtbzPWX/Side-Quest-vt65o-VWOYc.png)

Once you’ve done that, open BONELAB then from the main menu go to Mods then External.

Enjoy!
